give up Jessekinss, Peeter is right & has for more experience in this shit than you do, your making your self look dumber than you already are.
[/quote]

I’m sure he’s right, that’s why the problem is still not solved. <That is sarcasm just in case you wanted to be a smartass.
I don’t care if he did a few GUI’s lol. I couldn’t care less. Fact of the matter is, not only did he NOT solve the case, he also used a help site to find out what the problem was (and still failed). Am I suppose to care if I look “dumber” to you? You’re no one to me, I don’t care for your opinion, lmfao.
I suggest you wipe that brown stuff off your nose. You might have got that from PeterPan’s ass.[/quote]

Wow at referring to the Java API as a “help site”. You’re really losing this battle, and badly.

item.title: Reporting?
item.dc:creator: @Jessekinss Jessekinss
item.description:
@Jessekinss wrote:

[quote=“Peeter, post:53, topic:307252”][quote author=Jessekinss link=topic=403414.msg2997504#msg2997504 date=1255719946]

aight Peeter can you please clean up this thread and try and offer a working solution?
thanks

It’s been offered already.

Missing, wrong, it’s all the same difference. Look at the bigger picture instead of the smaller one.

How exactly does missing equal wrong? We can keep on going at this, or you can simply admit defeat.

Because we were both wrong. You said it was in the wrong place (he said it wasn’t) and then my suggested idea. Oh we’re going to keep going you should already know that. It will end up like it always does. You raging & abusing and me laughing.

I’m rather sure all I did in this post was laugh at you. Meaning your argument is yet again invalid.

No, lmfao. It means you’re trying to be a funny guy and failing at it. Get back to the real subject.

If your argument is valid then point out where I said it’s in the wrong place.

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/ClassNotFoundException.html

Point still valid kiddo. That was your answer.
[/quote]

http://img12.imageshack.us/i/reporthandlererror.jpg/ < take a look at his error. You’re just puffing air, I won.[/quote]

Lol. He said he had it in the right spot idiot. The only other things he could have fucked up on is the name. It’s also funny that Mr. Expert GUI programmer over here had to resort to a help website, but that’s another story.

Read full topic
